identificationModule.briefTitle: An Open-label, Long-term Study of Telmisartan Plus Amlodipine Fixed-dose Combination
identificationModule.officialTitle: An Open-label, Long-term Study of Telmisartan Plus Amlodipine Fixed-dose Combination

descriptionModule.briefSummary: To assess the long term safety and efficacy of telmisartan plus amlodipine FDC in patients with essential hypertension who failed to control their BP with either monotherapy

primaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Experienced Adverse Events
primaryOutcomes.description: An adverse event is defined as any untoward medical occurrence

primaryOutcomes.measure: Clinically Relevant Abnormalities for Changes in Blood Pressure and Pulse Rate Due to Position Change, Seated Pulse Rate, Laboratory Parameters and ECG
primaryOutcomes.description: Clinically relevant abnormalities for changes in blood pressure and pulse rate due to position change, seated pulse rate, laboratory parameters and ECG. New abnormal findings or worsening of baseline conditions were reported as adverse events.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: First administration of study treatment to 24 hours post last dosing of study treatment.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline in Seated Diastolic Blood Pressure at Week 8
secondaryOutcomes.description: mean reduction from pseud-baseline (after the washout) in seated diastolic blood pressure

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline in Seated Systolic Blood Pressure at Week 8
secondaryOutcomes.description: mean reduction from pseud-baseline (after the washout) in seated systolic blood pressure

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Seated DBP Control Rate at Trough After 8 Weeks
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of patients whose DBP \<90 mmHg after 8 weeks of treatment

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Seated SBP Control Rate at Trough After 8 Weeks
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of patients whose SBP \<140 mmHg after 8 weeks of treatment

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline in Seated Diastolic Blood Pressure
secondaryOutcomes.description: Mean reduction from pseud-baseline (after the washout) in seated diastolic blood pressure

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline in Seated Systolic Blood Pressure
secondaryOutcomes.description: mean reduction from pseud-baseline (after the washout) in seated systolic blood pressure

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Seated DBP Control Rate at Trough After 6 and 12 Months
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of patients whose DBP \<90 mmHg.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Seated SBP Control Rate at Trough After 6 and 12 Months
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of patients whose SBP \<140 mmHg

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Seated DBP Response Rate at Trough
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of patients whose DBP \<90 mmHg or decreased from pseudo-baseline by \>=10 mmHg at 6 months and 12 months

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Seated SBP Response Rate at Trough
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of patients whose SBP \<140 mmHg or decreased deom pseudo-baseline by \>=20 mmHg after 6 and 12 months

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Seated Blood Pressure Normalisation at Trough
secondaryOutcomes.description:
Percentage of patients when classifying their blood pressure measurements into the following classes at 6 and 12 months:

Optimal: SBP \<120 mmHg and DBP \<80 mmHg

Normal: SBP \>=120 mmHg or DBP \>=80 mmHg and SBP \<130 mmHg or DBP \<85 mmHg

High normal: SBP \>=130 mmHg or DBP \>=85 mmHg and SBP \<140 mmHg or DBP \<90 mmHg

No: SBP \>=140 mmHg or DBP \>=90 mmHg

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

1. Patients with essential hypertension
2. Outpatient

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients whose SBP \>=180 mmHg or DBP \>=110 mmHg at the end of treatment visit of the double-blind treatment period in the "non-responder trials"
* Patients who have met any of the exclusion criteria defined in the "non-responder trials"

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants Who Experienced Adverse Events
outcomeMeasures.description: An adverse event is defined as any untoward medical occurrence
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Treated set for safety, which was the analysis set including all the patients who had valid measurements after drug administration.

outcomeMeasures.description: mean reduction from pseud-baseline (after the washout) in seated diastolic blood pressure

outcomeMeasures.title: Seated Blood Pressure Normalisation at Trough
outcomeMeasures.description:
Percentage of patients when classifying their blood pressure measurements into the following classes at 6 and 12 months:

Optimal: SBP \<120 mmHg and DBP \<80 mmHg

High normal: SBP \>=130 mmHg or DBP \>=85 mmHg and SBP \<140 mmHg or DBP \<90 mmHg

No: SBP \>=140 mmHg or DBP \>=90 mmHg

adverseEventsModule.timeFrame: While being treated with T20+A5, T40/A5, T80/A5, T40/A5+additional treatment, T80/A5+additional treatment and within 24 hours from the last dosing of any of them.

seriousEvents.organSystem: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certainAgreement.otherDetails: Any publication of the result of this trial must be consistent with the Boehringer Ingelheim publication policy. The rights of the investigator and of the sponsor with regard to publication of the results of this trial are described in the investigator contract.
